Class StorageFile._Chunk

java.lang.Object
  StorageFile._Chunk
Enclosing class:
StorageFile
private class StorageFile._Chunk
extends Object

Represents either a free block or a key/data pair in the file.

Field Summary
private  int _flags
          The flags stored with the chunk on disk
private  int _headerSize
          The size of the header.
private  String _key
          The key of the chunk, or if null == _key, it's a free block
private  long _next
          The offset of the next chunk in the file
private  long _offset
          The offset of this chunk in the file

Field Detail

_offset

private long _offset
The offset of this chunk in the file

_next

private long _next
The offset of the next chunk in the file

_key

private String _key
The key of the chunk, or if null == _key, it's a free block

_flags

private int _flags
The flags stored with the chunk on disk

_headerSize

private int _headerSize
The size of the header. _offset + _headerSize would be the offset of the data

Constructor Detail

StorageFile._Chunk

public StorageFile._Chunk(long offset)
                   throws IOException
Read Chunk

Parameters:
offset - The offset to read the chunk from the file.
Throws:
IOException - If there are any IO errors

StorageFile._Chunk

public StorageFile._Chunk(long offset,
                          String key,
                          byte[] keyData,
                          byte[] data,
                          boolean compressed)
                   throws IOException
Writes a chunk at the given offset, with the key and data. These chunks are only intended to be appended to the end or completely fill a block.

Parameters:
offset - The offset in the file to store key/data
key - The key as a String
keyData - The key as a byte[], this is to cut down on the conversions to byte[]
data - The data to associate with the key
compressed - Is data compressed
Throws:
IOException - If there are any IO errors or if we split a free block

StorageFile._Chunk

public StorageFile._Chunk(long offset,
                          String key,
                          byte[] keyData,
                          byte[] data,
                          int off,
                          int len,
                          boolean compressed)
                   throws IOException
Writes a chunk at the given offset, with the key and data.

Parameters:
offset - The offset in the file to store key/data
key - The key as a String
keyData - The key as a byte[], this is to cut down on the conversions to byte[]
data - The data to associate with the key
off - The offset in data where the real data begins
len - The number of actual data bytes to use
compressed - Is data compressed
Throws:
IOException - If there are any IO errors or if we split a free block

StorageFile._Chunk

private StorageFile._Chunk(long o,
                           long n)
                    throws IOException
A new free chunk at a given location and size.

Parameters:
o - The offset of the chunk
n - The offset of the next chunk
Throws:
IOException - If there are any IO errors
Method Detail

expandTo

public void expandTo(long offset,
                     long next)
              throws IOException
Reallocates this chunk to encompass other chunks.

Parameters:
offset - if 0, ignored, otherwise the new offset for this chunk
next - if 0, ignored, otherwise the next next for this chunk
Throws:
IOException - If there are any IO errors, or this chunk is not a free block

allocate

public StorageFile._Chunk allocate(String key,
                                   byte[] data,
                                   boolean compressed)
                            throws IOException
Allocates a data chunk.

Parameters:
key - The key as a String
data - The data to associate with the key
compressed - Is data compressed
Returns:
no-null if there is a free chunk created after this one
Throws:
IOException - If there are any IO errors, we're allocating an already allocated block or will not contain the key/data

compressed - Is data compressed

free

public boolean free()
Is this chunk free.

Returns:
true if this chunk is available for use, false if it currently has a key

compressed

public boolean compressed()
Determines if the data in this chunk is compressed.

Returns:
true if the data returned by get should be decompressed, false if it can be used as is

makeFree

public void makeFree()
              throws IOException
Marks this block as available for use

Throws:
IOException - If there are any IO errors, or this chunk is already free

size

public long size()
Gets the size of the data of this chunk.

Returns:
For an allocated block, it returns the size of the data (compressed size if it is compressed). For a free block, it returns the size of the block not being used to flag it as a free block.

size

public long size(byte[] key)
Returns the size of data that could fit in this block with the given key.

Parameters:
key - The bytes that would be used for the key
Returns:
The number of bytes data could be for this block

offset

public long offset()
The offset in the file of the header for this chunk.

Returns:
The offset in the file of the header for this chunk.

next

public long next()
The offset of the next block.

Returns:
The offset of the next block, or the end of the file if this is the last chunk.

key

public String key()
The key for this chunk, or null if this chunk is not allocated

Returns:
The key for this chunk, or null if this chunk is not allocated

get

public byte[] get()
           throws IOException
Gets the data for this chunk.

Returns:
The raw bytes for this chunk from the disk
Throws:
IOException - If there are any IO errors

_readFlags

private void _readFlags()
                 throws IOException
Reads the flags for this chunk from disk.
Postcondition: Sets _flags

Throws:
IOException - If there are any IO errors, or if the flags are not valid

_smallFreeBlock

private void _smallFreeBlock()
Sets this chunk up as a small free block read from disk.
Precondition: _flags must already be set.
Postcondition: _headerSize is set.
Postcondition: _next is set.

_readSizeBlock

private long _readSizeBlock()
                     throws IOException
Reads the data size from the block on disk.
Precondition: _flags must be set correctly.
Precondition: Must have just read the flags byte from the chunk
Precondition: must not be called for a small free block
Postcondition: _key is set if it is free.
Postcondition: _headerSize is set if it is free.
Postcondition: _next is set if it is free.

Returns:
The size of the data if the block is allocated, -1 if it is a free block
Throws:
IOException - If there are any IO errors

_readKey

private void _readKey()
               throws IOException
Reads the key from the block.
Precondition: Must have just read the data size
Postcondition: _key is set.
Postcondition: _headerSize is set.

Throws:
IOException - If there are any IO errors

_free

private void _free()
            throws IOException
Marks a block as free in memory and on disk.
Postcondition: _headerSize is set
Postcondition: _flags set

Throws:
IOException - If there are any IO errors
